headline.print_headline: William Styron, 81, Novelist Who Transcended Roots, Dies

docs.lead_paragraph: Mr. Styron's early work, including "Lie Down in Darkness," won him wide recognition as a distinctive voice of the South, and an heir to William Faulkner. In subsequent fiction, like "The Confessions of Nat Turner" and "Sophie's Choice," he transcended his own immediate world and moved across historical and cultural lines. Critics and readers alike ranked him among the best of the generation that suceeded Hemingway and Faulkner.

headline.print_headline: William Styron, a Leading Novelists, Dies at 81
headline.main: William Styron, a Leading Novelist, Dies at 81

docs.lead_paragraph: The author explored difficult historical and moral questions in novels like “Sophie’s Choice” and “The Confessions of Nat Turner.”
docs.snippet: The author explored difficult historical and moral questions in novels like “Sophie’s Choice” and “The Confessions of Nat Turner.”
